Be aware  there are little sand storms kicking  up near Mars One Base, but the big  one you spotted is turning south. It  shouldn't be a factor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck takes a breath, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all pretty excited here and  we're sure you must be feeling the  same. Enjoy your meal and get a good  night's sleep. We anticipate that  tomorrow morning you will be Go for  Mars Orbital Insertion.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS RECOVERY. LOWER HAB. DAY
dialogues.text: WHOOPS OF JOY from McConnell's crew. Woody and Terri high five each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless you and goodnight. End of  transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor screen GOES BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS RECOVERY. LOWER HAB. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The lighting is subdued for a sleep period, but everyone' too restless. There's a low HUM of equipment.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EVA AIRLOCK. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Terri and Phil are playing computer Monopoly under a sing light. Terri is using touch-screen technology to move her piece. She glances at Phil. He has spread some M&Ms o letting them drift in mid-air as he performs his ritual  weeding out of the red ones. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you opened up your meal packs  and found that, instead of putting  in everything but red ones, they'd  made a mistake and put in only red  ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's a funny notion. And what  if in your meal packs, instead of  brown rice, there were spring-loaded  spikes that shot into your eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) How did you ever pass the psych  evaluation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're schizophrenic, they take  the higher score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches the screen to roll the dice.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS RECOVERY. LOWER HAB. NIGHT
dialogues.text: McConnell, in his cubicle, looks away from the photo of  Maggie. Haunted by memories. He rises, flips through the in a storage case, pulls one out. He holds this carefully hesitating, then feeds it into his computer. Immediately screen saver vanishes and we see

dialogues.speaker: HOME VIDEO OF A PARTY
dialogues.text: An impromptu celebration, a bunch of friends gathered in semi-darkened living room. The footage is HANDHELD, a bit jerky. People have paper plates of food, beers in hand,  everyone is a little tipsy. Debra is there, Terri, Phil,  Cote, Kirov, others. They're watching a STILL PHOTO SEQUE shown on a large screen TV, with commentary by Luke and W

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST PHOTO
dialogues.text: Is of a small boy (YOUNG MCCONNELL) in his pajamas, kneel in front of a Christmas tree. He's grinning ecstatically he holds up a brand new model rocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's first ship was seriously  underpowered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUGHTER at this. Some AD LIB CRACKS about the painfully haircut and the pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND PHOTO
dialogues.text: Is of a gawky-looking teenage girl (YOUNG MAGGIE), standi on a porch at night, posing a bit self-consciously by a  telescope on its tripod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie was always starstruck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More LAUGHTER, plus some digs about the nerdy eyeglasses braces. VIDEOCAMERA swings around the room, REVEALING the adult JIM and MAGGIE. They sit side by side on the hearth leaning into each other, looking very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you guys for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More LAUGHTER. Everyone's having a great time. The VIDEOC swings back towards the TV screen as

dialogues.speaker: THIRD PHOTO APPEARS
dialogues.text: Jim and Maggie, young adults, standing on the wing of a  fighter jet. Both in Air Force flight suits, helmets in h Suntanned, cocky, flashing radiant smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they met at the Air Force  Academy, it was "love at first  flight."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GROANS and LAUGHTER from the offscreen watchers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that, NASA training was tough.  All Jim could think about was  exploring a heavenly body. More ribald  LAUGHTER, as

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH PHOTO APPEARS
dialogues.text: Maggie and Jim, tethered together, floating weightlessly space suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Maggie, as you can see, kept him  on a short leash. Until...

dialogues.speaker: A FIFTH PHOTO
dialogues.text: Shows McConnell, in a dress uniform, leaning in to kiss  Maggie, who wears a white bridal gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mission accomplished!

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL, IN THE PRESENT
dialogues.text: As he smiles at this, hearing the renewed LAUGHTER and CH the AD-LIBBED DIGS from the video. He becomes aware he's alone. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Stands in the doorway of his cubicle. Their eyes meet. Th both smile, turning back to the video. Remembering.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VIDEO
dialogues.text: Luke and Woody have stepped forward, INTO SHOT, standing the sides of the TV, where the last photo lingers. Luke w his hands, hushing everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today we celebrate a new chapter in  their story. And guys, it's a pretty  historic one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men raise champagne flutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hear it for the newly-announced  Captain and Co-Captain of Mars One.  To Jim and Maggie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHEERS at this, repeats of "Jim and Maggie!" Luke grins,  giving a little signal, and we see

dialogues.speaker: A FINAL PHOTO
dialogues.text: Of Maggie in Jim's arms, both of them in goofy tropical  vacation wear, smiling. Evidently a photo taken in the su somewhere, but here it's been crudely superimposed onto a Martian landscape. Laughter greets this unlikely image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you guys land, it'll prove once  and for all there's no intelligent  life on Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More hoots of LAUGHTER, CATCALLS, but Maggie jumps in to  protest, as the VIDEOCAMERA SWINGS TO HER AND JIM. Terri  sits nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, c'mon, what if I'm right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, here we go! Don't get her  started! Somebody put on some music!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our sister planet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh brother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUGHTER at this, and Maggie joins in. She's a good sport

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie, why does this have to be  about us? Mars is a great opportunity  for pure science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do the science. And we'll do  it very well. That's what we've  trained for. But what if there's  more...? In all our myths, in every  human culture, Mars has always held  a special attraction. What if that  means something? Only we don't  understand it yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mood of the party is changing, as everyone is caught in Maggie's spell. She has a radiant simplicity. The VIDE CAMERA DRIFTS IN ON HER; we are caught up, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The universe is not chaos. It's  connection. Life reaches out for  life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at McConnell, smiles. He takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what we were born for, isn't  it? To stand on a new world, and  look beyond it to the next one. It's  who we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silence; the guests are enchanted by the purity of her  passion. She smiles, suddenly self-conscious. She hadn't  meant to get so carried away.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PRESENT
dialogues.text: Reaches out, gently taps the keyboard, FREEZING the scree He and Woody, their eyes shining, stare at her image. A b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm good to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody glances at him. It's true. Rather than being sadden McConnell seems to have taken on new strength. A renewed  sense of wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all these years... Can you  believe it? Tomorrow we'll be standing  on Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody nods, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? She may have been  right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that wasn't a quake down there,  then something else caused it. Or  planned it... You're thinking the  same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never been out of my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. You realize what this means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell nods. Looks again at Maggie's face on the scree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew, Woody. She was the only  one of us that ever thought there  might be something down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and we're not leaving until we  find out... Deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell nods. They clasp hands briefly. Deal. Then Wood turns. Before leaving, he hesitates just a moment, turnin back. One last thought, and he doesn't know he's going to say it until it comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie was the best of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell looks at him, silent but grateful. Woody goes.  McConnell turns back, looking at her smiling face, frozen the screen.

dialogues.speaker: MARS LOOMS AHEAD OF US.
dialogues.text: As seen through the cockpit windows. Huge, beautiful, MUC CLOSER now. We can make out swirling pink clouds, large  surface features. It's just before Martian dawn, the next morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Range 6783 and closing. 35 minutes  till Mars Orbital Capture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, people let's look sharp. If we  overshoot, there's no coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and drifting through eternity  will ruin your whole day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cockpit, Woody and McConnell are in the pilot and pilot's wearing space suits but not yet helmets. AS CAMER PULLS BACK AND AWAY, we see them making instrument adjust in preparation for MOI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delta V systems initialized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charge primary APU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engaged. Charged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Select HPU fuel cells for run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie main bus to systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Select H2/O2 HPU and fuel cells for  open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H2/O2 control valves open.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EVA AIRLOCK. NIGHT
dialogues.text: ...Where Phil and Terri sit side by side at a pair of  computers, relaying cockpit commands to the systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charge flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charged and on-line

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reset PW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transfer protocol data from EVA  station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transferred. Awaiting track  confirmation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a sudden LOUD, BRITTLE POP from somewhere overhea and Phil's gloved hand, hovering over a computer screen, punctured through and through. The screen itself is holed and spiderwebbed with a loud CRACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh!

dialogues.speaker: PHIL HOLDS UP HIS HAND
dialogues.text: As he and Terri stare at it, dumbfounded. Thick droplets blood leak out and begin to swirl away, sucked up towards the venting puncture in the hull over head. The astronaut helmets dangle up there, awaiting use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in God's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly we hear HIGH PITCHED ALARMS SOUNDING, then the  PINGING OF MORE TINY MISSILES, slashing across the ship's outer skin.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY AND MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Are staring back from the cockpit, reacting in astonishme to Phil's drifting blood and to the alarms. Then Woody  suddenly understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micrometeoroids

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scanning sensors) Breach hits in the hull!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she seizes his wounded hand, tries to stop the bleedin He's staring at a gauge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outgassing! Losing pressure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody, seal the breech!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: As he unbuckles, dives from the cockpit back down into th EVA, and floats quickly over to a storage hatch. He yanks this open pulling out a

dialogues.speaker: PATCH GUN
dialogues.text: Then spins around in zero-G, as his eyes track

dialogues.speaker: THE RISING DROPLETS OF BLOOD
dialogues.text: Which give a telltale hint of the puncture's location,  somewhere up among the dangling helmets on the "ceiling."

dialogues.speaker: WOODY PUSHES OFF
dialogues.text: Rising to this area, and shoves aside a helmet with a  shattered faceplate -- its label reads "MCCONNELL" -- to  REVEAL A BREECH IN THE HULL. Jagged metal edges, dangling insulation. The blood droplets are whirling out through h going into the vacuum of space. Quickly Woody stuffs the muzzle of the patch gun into the puncture, firing a thick grey sealant. We hear MORE PINGS ECHOING LOUDLY, but after a few seconds they DIMINISH, th abruptly STOP. The KLAXONS continue to wail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill those alarms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell punches buttons, MUTING THE ALARMS, and they al strain to listen, faces tense and sweating. A long beat. the meteor shower has passed by, as abruptly as it appear The astronauts turn, becoming aware of a strange phenomen

dialogues.speaker: PHIL'S BLOOD DROPLETS
dialogues.text: Have stopped in place, wobbling eerily as perfect spheres the zero-G. Then suddenly they start moving again, faster and faster, in a new direction. Down through the open cor tunnel that leads to the lower Hab.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Stares at a gauge that confirms what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still outgassing in the lower Hab!  There must be another hole down there,  even bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Losing pressure fast! We're gonna  decompress!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, how long until zero  atmosphere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Four minutes, nine seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we get below 20% atmosphere, the  power will shut down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive! A vacuum inside the ship  would cause a total electrical  failure. The nav computers will fry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Woody) We'll lose all control. We won't be  able to fire the engines to capture  Mars orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a computer screen flickers, freezes. Phil punch keys with his good hand. What he sees shocks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already starting. The primary L- 1 hub has been smashed. The systems  are crashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody looks back at his crew, struggling to project more  calm than he really feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody switch to suit oxygen. We  beat this in the simulator, we can  do it here. Jim, you've got the ship.  I'm going EVA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at him, stunned by their immense task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, people, let's go! Let's work  the problem!

dialogues.speaker: INT. EVA AIRLOCK. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Terri, now helmeted, is putting Woody's helmet on him, bu something's in the way, chafing his neck. He reaches into his suit, pulls out...

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAIN
dialogues.text: From around his neck, with his little Flash Gordon rocket dangling.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY HANDS THIS TO TERRI
dialogues.text: As they share a brief, loving glance, but there's no time for words. She tightens his helmet ring, and he brushes h gloved fingertips on her faceplate. Then he hurries towar the inner hatch door, where McConnell is throwing airlock switches. Woody and McConnell exchange a look. At the EVA computer panel, Phil is shutting down non-esse power drains, trying to get the main computer system back line. His wounded hand makes this difficult and painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, it's still bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the pressure on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty percent atmosphere...

dialogues.speaker: INT./EXT. AIRLOCK. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The outer airlock door is now open, revealing stars, as W drifts through it into space. He's now wearing the MMU, a oversized jet pack like the ones used by the shuttle  astronauts.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL'S HELMET.
dialogues.text: With its shattered faceplate -- now useless -- drifts pas Terri as she is wrapping med tape around gauze pads on Ph glove.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Floats up to them, checking on Phil's work at the compute

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, you've gotta get your spare  helmet from storage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time. Phil, can you keep the nav  computers on-line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get this damn machine to re- initialize! And the automated systems  just went down. We can't shut down  the hab rotation from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing pressure. You could  embolize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy percent atmosphere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell looks at her, knows she's right. But he starts anyway. Phil reaches out his good hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, I've got an idea. If you guys  can save enough atmosphere, I'll  disconnect the power in the main  computer bay, then jump start the  systems. I'll do a hard boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a radical, incredibly risky notion. McConnell sta hard at Phil. So does Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has that ever been tested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? These machines are  much too valuable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell looks from Terri to Phil. It's life and death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he turns, and the CAMERA FOLLOWS MCCONNELL as he pus away from the console and dives down into the core tunnel heading towards the

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where he emerges from the core into the rotating Hab d and pushes himself down a ladder toward the floor. He  accelerates as he gets closer to the floor, then rights  himself with a twist and lands on his feet -- now in grav

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS RECOVERY. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Woody, in the MMU, is hovering over the lower segment of Hab hull, and right away we see his problem. He can't rea the damaged spot because it's spinning past him, spewing  vapor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Jim, how we doin' on the AG?

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER HAB. NIGHT
dialogues.text: McConnell runs to a computer terminal and starts clicking with the mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one goddamn second. Come on,  c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voice print identification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Accepted. Shutting down artificial  gravitational rotation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell hears a sound up at the core tunnel. He turns,  it's Terri. She holds an small 0-2 cannister, marked with red cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell grabs onto a counter edge as...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SPACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Attitude control thrusters on the hull begin firing in pu The rotation of the lower Hab deck immediately starts to  slow down. The great red ball of Mars drifts by.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CORE TUNNEL. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Terri, lurching, grabs a ladder strut, and watches from t tunnel as...

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Is also jarred by the firing of the thrusters. The rotati slows until the Hab is still. Zero-G. McConnell floats. H and Terri can hear the terrifying sound of air whistling into space through the breach hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty per cent atmosphere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some light on the hole so I can  locate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a better idea. (shouts to Terri) Stay there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts rooting through Phil's storage area -- bags of  M&Ms, comic books -- looking for what he needs.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COCKPIT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Phil is now strapped into the pilot's seat. He's scared,  sweating hard, but concentrating fiercely as his one good hand works a battery-powered screwdriver. He's removing the panel of the main computer bay. Over th intercom, he can hear the merciless struggle going on  elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm topside, Jim, do you know which  sector?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm workin' on it!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SPACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The lower Hab deck is no longer revolving. Woody pops his thrusters and drifts over the metallic skin. But there's  such a vast area to search!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, uh, OK, this is gonna be like  searching for a needle in a haystack.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER HAB NIGHT
dialogues.text: McConnell locates a can of Dr. Pepper, shakes this violen then tosses it up to Terri, who's still in the tunnel mou She catches the drifting can, confused. When McConnell sp again, he's gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake out the liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, I don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake it out near the hull!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri shakes out soda from the open can. She and McConnel watch the brown stream of fluid swirl up into the air, ca by escaping oxygen. It rises towards the "ceiling" of the outer hull, like a miniature tornado.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SPACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Woody still drifts over the hull, searching intently as h frustration builds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon, where are you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty per cent atmosphere...

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER HAB. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Terri, staring at the ceiling, sees something remarkable.

dialogues.speaker: THE SODA STREAM
dialogues.text: Swirling ever tighter, has formed a whirlpool that's now  being sucked out through the breach hole in the hull. She can now see the ugly puncture for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) Woody, the breech is in sector four!  Sector four, copy that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy, I' heading there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri turns, excited by McConnell's triumph; she's just i time to see him collapse to the floor below her, as he st to lose consciousness. He's deathly pale.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SPACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Woody spots a tiny geyser of brownish ice crystals spouti out of the hull of the lower Hab. It's some distance away from him, but clearly visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, marveling) Sonofabitch. You never did that in  the simulator.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER HAB. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Terri pushes off from the ladder, drifting weightlessly d to McConnell. She opens the valve of the oxygen cannister pushing the plastic mask over McConnell's face. He sucks air, color returning to his skin as he revives.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER'S GUTS.
dialogues.text: An incredible tangle of tubes, wires, chips, as Phil's gl fingers -- both hands now -- probe desperately through th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, you little bastard,  where are you...?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL WINCES WITH PAIN.
dialogues.text: As he moves his hands and forearms deep inside the comput bay. Around him, several of the smaller screens and gauge are starting to malfunction, the data streams breaking ap streaking into electronic snow. He shoots a tense glance

dialogues.speaker: THE NAVIGATIONAL MONITOR
dialogues.text: Which is flickering crazily. It shows the ship moving muc closer to its critical MOI point, indicated by a flashing red triangle aimed down at the Martian surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty percent atmosphere...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SPACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Woody, popping his thrusters, moves as fast as he can tow the protruding finger of crystal, but he's not there yet. All of a sudden Woody's thrusters cut out. The ship is mo by, a meter beneath him. Woody punches his arm controls.  Nothing. Then just as the outer edge of the hab starts to pass him the thrusters kick back in. Woody grabs the edge, starts move to the hole. Woody lets out a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER HAB. NIGHT
dialogues.text: McConnell, holding his breath, grabs a patch gun from a  storage locker. Terri's still got the 0-2 cannister. He n to her, and together they push off from the floor, leapin weightlessly up to the other side of the Hab, the "ceilin They reach the gaping puncture, which they now see has be only partially dammed by the soda ice.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER'S INTERIOR
dialogues.text: As Phil's gloved fingers finally locate the plug he's bee searching for. He hopes. And grip it firmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: PHIL TAKES A DEEP BREATH.
dialogues.text: Says a silent prayer. Then he yanks the plug. SHRILL WHIN ELECTRONIC CRACKLES from all around him, as the systems a abruptly shut down, in a way they were never meant to be  mishandled. Terrifyingly, a couple of the monitors arc to each other as they die. Dodging sparks, Phil stares at

dialogues.speaker: THE NAVIGATIONAL MONITOR
dialogues.text: As it also flickers and dies. Now they're flying blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty percent atmosphere...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SPACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Woody arrives at the ice finger, knocks away the big crys then pulls his patch equipment from a pouch.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER HAB. NIGHT
dialogues.text: In the Hab, Terri uses the base of the 0-2 cannister to s away the interior ice chunk, then McConnell, who's gettin wobbly again, blasts the hole with the epoxy gun. As he w Terri gives him another hit of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty percent atmosphere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights flicker out in the Hab.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SPACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Outside, Woody slaps a big square patch over the hole, ri off the backing.

dialogues.speaker: THE PATCH
dialogues.text: As it changes color and shrinks, drawing itself down into the metal of the hull.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER'S INTERIOR.
dialogues.text: As Phil's fingers re-connect the same plug.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL PULLS HIS HAND OUT
dialogues.text: From inside the computer bay. He's trembling, sweat-strea inside his faceplate. Blood has soaked through his gauze  pads. His good hand hovers over the red main power switch The moment of truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK... OK now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a dramatic click, he throws the switch, hard-booting the computer system back on. He stares at the screens. Nothing happens!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened, furious, Phil bangs on the switch with his  cordless screwdriver. When all else fails, hit something.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOWER HAB. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Feeble starlight from the viewports. McConnell and Terri, drifting side by side, stare at one another, expecting to die within seconds. It feels like an agonizing eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty percent atmosphere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell's eyes widen, as he realizes this is the same a the last reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pressure stabilizing... Atmosphere  level increasing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri and McConnell look at each other. Tears of relief i her eyes. He is exhausted, nearly spent, but manages a gr She holds the 0-2 mask up to his face, and as he grips it breathing deeply, they hug one another.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COCKPIT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The lights and computer screens are flickering back on. A of them! The cockpit lights up like a Christmas tree. Phi bounces up and down like a madman, babbling in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Awriiiight! Had it all the way.  Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgetting his injury, he pounds his gloved fist on the  console in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wrings his injured hand, then his gaze is caught by

dialogues.speaker: THE NAVIGATIONAL MONITOR
dialogues.text: Which pops back on, showing the ship and the MOI point co perilously close together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he keys his mike urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back in here, guys!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SPACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Woody floats above the repaired hole, scanning the nearby surface of the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, there's a lot of scarring...  I'd better check for other punctures  while I'm out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, negative. Woody, get back  inside. We've gotta start the  checklist for orbital insertion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; reluctantly) Copy, I'm heading there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody jets back towards the open EVA hatch. But as he rea this, about to re-enter the ship, he's captured momentari by a breathtakingly beautiful sight below him.

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE OVER MARS
dialogues.text: As the huge planet is REVEALED in all its red, unearthly  glory. It's so close now that individual features can be  seen with the naked eye -- the vast chasm of Valles Marin and then Olympus Mons, poking all the way up through the  Martian atmosphere. A stunning, alluring spectacle.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Stares down at Mars, enthralled, as sunlight floods the s of the spaceship, sparkles off his visor. Dawn, after a v long night indeed. He whispers lovingly, under his breath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he stirs himself out of his reverie and hurries thro the EVA hatch. CAMERA DRIFTS QUICKLY BACK and down along the hull as sta sunlight flares off the big propellant tanks, three in a  row, and the thick silver tubes that join them. There's a good deal of scarring and denting from the meteor shower. Then, as the ship begins to MOVE OUT OF FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one of these tubes, a feeder line to the engine bells, see a scatter of tiny, undetected holes, about the size o the eraser at the end of a pencil. So small, so apparentl harmless...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EVA AIRLOCK. DAY
dialogues.text: As Woody enters, stripped from the MMU, dripping with swe McConnell is waiting for him. For a moment the two men ju look at each other, then they surge forward into a fierce hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Know what? You've got enough left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell looks at him, understands. Terri sits nearby, where she has just finished stitching Phil's hand. As Woody goes to her, she rises from her sea and looks at him tears of relief and pride in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of cake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Easier than the cha-cha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scoops her into his arms; they kiss passionately. Phil is blinking; something seems to be getting into his eyes. His voice catches for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're getting so  cocky about. We scored better times  in the sim at least twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) How's his hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri separates from Woody, looks down at Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems OK. Couple of the tendons are  going to be a little tight for awhile.  Try to close your fingers, Phil,  nice and slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil starts curling up his fingers. The middle digit rema extended in the universal gesture. They all consider this for a moment. Then Phil looks up cheerfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least I'll still be able to  drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a split-second they get it, and the whole crew roar with LAUGHTER, which builds and builds; they're almost gi with the relief of the tension...

dialogues.speaker: MARS RECOVERY
dialogues.text: Sails INTO VIEW, with small attitude thrusters firing as great ship maneuvers into position for its orbital-captur burn. Mars looks very large, blood-red. The entire specta is majestic, awe-inspiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, we're ready to light this candle.  Go/No Go for braking burn and MOI.  Engines?

dialogues.speaker: INT. COCKPIT. DAY
dialogues.text: All four astronauts are strapped in, fully suited and  helmeted. Mars looms through the cockpit windows. The  atmosphere is electric with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nav.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are Go for the burn. I'm fueling  the engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips three switches, in rapid sequence, and...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS RECOVERY. DAY
dialogues.text: As we MOVE IN on the damaged fuel line, we see a tiny but steady spray of fuel venting from the hole caused by the  meterorite. This freezes into eerie streamers and chunks, which slowly drift away from the ship. They're quite  beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Optimum angle of entry minus seven  degrees. Six... Five...

dialogues.speaker: INT. COCKPIT. DAY
dialogues.text: Woody looks at the others for moment -- everyone is set,  looking good -- then reaches for a last switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four... Three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody hesitates, then glances at McConnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell, moved by this honor, nods. He reaches out to t the switch himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the countdown indicator reaches "0000.00.00", a final  signal PINGS, and he flips the switch.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS RECOVERY. DAY
dialogues.text: In total silence, the engines ignite. The second they do, the streamers of frozen fuel explode in a white flash.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COCKPIT. DAY
dialogues.text: With alarms sounding, the four astronauts are slammed  violently forward, against their restraints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut down engines!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Woody both reach out, straining against the incred G-forces, and manage to grab a red emergency lever, yanki it down hard.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS RECOVERY. DAY
dialogues.text: Too late! IN SLOW MOTION, we see a terrifyingly violent c reaction. The fuel tanks themselves explode, one after  another. The supporting metal struts are vaporized. The s panels are snapped off. Two of the huge engine bells are  smashed sideways, out of alignment, while the third, trai pieces of the cowling, goes hurtling off, PAST CAMERA, li a flaming cannon ball. The entire aft section of the ship including much of the lower Hab, instantly becomes a shre charred tangle of metal, and even worse, the explosion ca what's left of the ship -- mainly the EVA chamber and coc to tumble end over end, cartwheeling down towards Mars.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COCKPIT. DAY
dialogues.text: In the windows, Mars goes crazily in and out of view. The astronauts, flung this way, then that, are all fighting  against unconsciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engines negative! No response! I've  got no attitude control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manual separation! Blow the bolts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative! The CM doesn't have enough  thrust to correct this rotation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're too steep! Falling into the  atmosphere...!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS RECOVERY. DAY
dialogues.text: From further away, the charred remainder of the ship can seen spinning down towards Mars, which now fills the scre looming as large as Earth, when seen from the space shutt The ship's motion is mercifully slowing as it hits the ou atmosphere, but just as clearly this steep, unplanned ang of entry dooms it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, at this angle we'll burn up!

dialogues.speaker: ON A COMPUTER.
dialogues.text: Their ANGLE OF ENTRY is shown -- much too direct -- with indicated swerve into blinking red disaster. Warnings fla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time've we got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! Three minutes? I don't  know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell's mind is racing furiously, desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the REMO?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Resupply Module? Why? That's not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil punches buttons. ON THE SCREEN a second ellipse appe a blinking orange dot labelled "REMO." It appears to be s intersecting with their own trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, it's close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, how close?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken) I-I don't know. It'll take time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time! Figure it out!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil frantically types in commands on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, we're dead stick, there's no  way to maneuver this ship into a  link-up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the ship. Just us. We have to go  EVA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at him, stunned. Leave the ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to transfer in suits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jim -- if we don't make it --  if we miss the REMO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no other choice! Phil, how  close?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One kilometer, that's the best I can  do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at Woody. We feel the full, terrible weight of his responsibility. Four lives hang on his call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare to abandon ship.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SPACE. DAY
dialogues.text: The astronauts are outside the ship, tethered to each oth with long shock cords. Other cords, clipped to their suit trail gear bags. Phil clutches a silver metallic case -- precious computer repair kit. Woody is in the MMU. They'r all rotating at the same speed as the ship behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my mark, seven percent left  thruster. Three, two, one, fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four astronauts fire a brief, simultaneous burst from the tiny attitude control thrusters in their suits. This  stops their rotation, bringing their travel under control The ship continues spinning in the background. Woody takes a final look at the charred, doomed Mars Reco The only home they've known for six months. He exchanges silent glance with the others. They all expect to be dead the next few minutes. Woody takes a breath, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops the big thrusters on the MMU and starts heading a from the ship. The cord between Woody and the others pull taut and they start to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of Woody leading them away from the crippled spaceship,  against the magnificent backdrop of the blood-red planet  below. Four tiny figures, all alone in space.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL AND THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: As Phil looks back, his eyes searching the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, sadly) Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Hey. When we get back? We really  will have to try this in the sim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to smile. So does she.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we doin' on fuel, Woody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody eyes a small display screen on his forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at fifty percent. (looking down) But I don't see the REMO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is looking back at the curve of Mars against bla space, expecting to see the REMO coming up behind them.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: Happens to glance directly below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black outline of the little cargo craft drifts agains the red of Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. She's not where I thought  she'd be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to miss her.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Looks again at his display screen, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't catch it. Not like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking quickly) Use the tether.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a compartment on the side of the MMU, Woody pulls ou

dialogues.speaker: THE TETHER GUN
dialogues.text: About the size of a large flare gun. There's a carabiner- like hook five inches in diameter on the front of the gun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll only have one, maybe two shots  before she's out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be better if I leave you the  gun while I run out to the REMO.  I've got enough fuel left for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be going too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll aim to overshoot, then brake  like hell; arc it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell looks at him. They both know how risky this is, and they also know it's their only chance. Woody flips a  switch on the gun and pulls on the hook. Off it comes,  trailing wire. Woody clips the hook to the MMU, then hand McConnell the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeya in a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell nods. Woody and Terri exchange a look -- tender loving -- then Woody turns around and fires the MMU jets full throttle. As Woody pulls away, line unspools from th tether gun.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY AND THE REMO
dialogues.text: Woody is chasing the REMO from above. It's as if he were an airplane, trying to land on a car racing along a freew Woody is picking up speed quickly. Maybe too quickly. He  checks his armpad display screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm on path to overshoot. I'm  gonna take the edge off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody starts braking with the MMU thrusters as hard as he can.

dialogues.speaker: THE THRUSTERS
dialogues.text: Glowing with orange flame. They suddenly cut off.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY'S EYES
dialogues.text: Show alarm. He checks his display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out. Coming in hot. Still long. (beat) Abandoning the unit. I'll brake with  suit jets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody hits some buttons and the MMU's latches snap open. grabs the hook connected to the tether line, then pushes  himself free of the MMU, starts firing his small suit jet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still going very quickly.

dialogues.speaker: WITH MCCONNELL, TERRI AND PHIL
dialogues.text: Floating close together. The tether line is still unspool from the gun. They watch Woody, below and ahead of them, he races towards the REMO. Terri's heart is in her throat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus. Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell reaches a glove out, touching her arm.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON WOODY
dialogues.text: Still speeding towards the REMO. His suit jets cut out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit jets gone. But I'm gonna make  contact...

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL, TERRI AND PHIL
dialogues.text: Stare at Woody's distant figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At what velocity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impact's gonna be a little rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At what velocity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Thirty-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look between McConnell and Terri; her face is stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna use the gun to slow you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You slow me and I'll fall short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too fast, Woody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No choice. I'll be okay. Here we  go...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY AND THE REMO
dialogues.text: Woody's coming down on the module at over thirty kilomete an hour. He holds the hook out in front of him with one h while grabbing the tether line with the other, and WHAM! he crashes into the REMO.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY'S HAND
dialogues.text: Slams the hook against a receiver on the hull of the REMO

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Tries to hold onto the tether line but his momentum is to much.

dialogues.speaker: HIS GLOVED HANDS
dialogues.text: Are ripped from the line.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Slides over the hull of the REMO.

dialogues.speaker: HIS HANDS
dialogues.text: Grasp in vain for something to grab onto. They drag and b and then finally his fingers close on... empty space.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Is past the REMO, freefalling toward Mars.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON MCCONNELL, TERRI AND PHIL
dialogues.text: As Terri screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell hits a button on the tether gun and starts to r them quickly in towards the REMO.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Tries his suit jets again -- they're empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falling away from the REMO.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL AND THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: Are being reeled towards the REMO by the tether line. Ano couple hundred meters to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody, what's your status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Uh, well, no suit jets and I'm still  carrying a good deal of velocity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as we get hooked up, I'll  come get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Uh, I'd have to say negative on that,  Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative on the transmission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I heard you. Negative on the  maneuver. I am not retrievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell and Terri share a quick, anguished look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody, that's not possible. You're  not going that fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comes down to the amount of fuel,  honey. The suit jets were designed  for attitude control, not travel.  Retrieval just won't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, believe me, I don't like it any  more than you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run the numbers, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell finishes looking over the numbers on his displa pad. Terri is staring at him. When McConnell's eyes meet  hers, they are red-rimmed. Haunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody, you hang tight. We'll get  into the REMO, fire her up, drop her  into a lower orbit and come scoop  you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna take half an hour to get  the REMO reoriented! Woody'll be...  He'll be in the atmosphere by then!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll have to get her moving  faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You listen to Jim, honey. It's a  good plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! We are going to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, look! The ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil points. McConnell and Terri look.

dialogues.speaker: THE MARS RECOVERY COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Is now several kilometers below and behind them. It's glo red... then orange... then white. Then it erupts into a g fireball, devoured by friction with Mars' atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL, TERRI AND PHIL IN DEEP SPACE
dialogues.text: Are all staring at this, awed, when McConnell happens to  look up again. He sees something alarming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are drifting quickly into the REMO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brakes!

dialogues.speaker: ALL THREE
dialogues.text: Fire their suit jets, slowing themselves down. They bang  into the REMO at about one-tenth the speed Woody did. The find handholds and grab on. McConnell hits a button on th tether gun.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOOK
dialogues.text: Releases from the REMO's hull. McConnell hits another but and it is reeled all the way into the gun. Phil is alread scrabbling at a latch on the REMO's outer airlock door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's get inside! Phil, start  dumping the cargo, or there won't be  room for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we need those supplies for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dump the cargo. Hang on, Woody!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Is looking back at the REMO. Smiles with relief to see th Terri has reached it safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to look at...

dialogues.speaker: MARS
dialogues.text: Right below him, filling his field of view. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Hey, Beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE REMO
dialogues.text: Terri makes a snap decision. She grabs the tether gun fro McConnell's surprised hands, then pushes off from the REM McConnell lunges after her, his gloved hand straining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's too late. She's already out of reach, and now fi her suit jets, pulling quickly away from the REMO.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Is reaching to activate his own jets, when

dialogues.speaker: PHIL'S HAND
dialogues.text: Grabs at his wrist, restraining this suicidal courage. Th stare at each other. McConnell wrenches his hand free, ha maddened, agonized, staring after Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Terri, it won't work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Terri keeps on going.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Looks back at the REMO, as he continues to fall towards M Sees the small figure of his wife heading towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what I'm not doing,  Woody. I'm not going to watch you  die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd do the same for me.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE REMO
dialogues.text: Phil is watching as Terri drops towards the distant twink of Woody's suit lights. The airlock door hangs open. Phil looks at McConnell, anguished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get inside. Dump the cargo, then  start the systems. (Phil hesitates) Now.

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN WOODY AND TERRI
dialogues.text: As Woody keys his mike. Tries to steady his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I wouldn't come for you. Not if  it just wasn't possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Terri, you can't! You don't have  enough fuel to get me, stop us both,  and get us back. Hell, you come any  farther and you won't have enough to  get back yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, goddammit! You have to  stop! You have to stop now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, Terri... It's no use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri looks at her armpad display.

dialogues.speaker: DISPLAY SCREEN
dialogues.text: As her fuel indicator drops from 50 percent to 49 to...

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: Releases her thumb from the toggle control.

dialogues.speaker: HER SUIT JETS
dialogues.text: Stop firing.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: Drifts, staring towards Woody.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI AND WOODY
dialogues.text: Are on the same trajectory, going the same speed, and onl about a hundred meters apart. But it might as well be  infinity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, honey...? You gotta go back  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri raises up the tether gun and pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOOK
dialogues.text: Comes shooting out of the gun, wire spooling out behind i

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Watches as it comes shooting down toward him.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING
dialogues.text: Woody gets larger and larger, the hook gets closer and cl and then SNAP! -- the hook stops. ANGLE ON THE TETHER GUN The wire has run all the way out.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Looks at the drifting hook, ten agonizing meters away fro him. His only life preserver.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: Hits the button and the wire starts winching fast back in the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna jet a little closer and  try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri, you spend any fuel getting  closer, you won't get back, and if  anyone tries to get you, they'll die  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from Terri.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOOK
dialogues.text: Is whipping back toward Terri and the gun. Woody's voice  cracks; he's very close to tears. Pleading now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, please go back. Go back and  help everyone get down to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hook slams back against the muzzle of the gun. Terri  resets the gun quickly, in an anguished fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not losing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you do it. I can't. I'm  sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: Looks at Woody, two hundred meters away, sensing somethin different in his voice now, a terrible resolve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody...?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Raises his hands to his helmet ring. His eyes shining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Terri. God how I love  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unscrews the ring, pops the seal. The outrush of air p his helmet all the way off. Woody shuts his eyes and open his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody, nooooooo...!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice crystals bloom with Woody's last breath. There's noth to suck in. He doesn't fight it. He lets death come.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: Tears streaming, chest heaving, frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody, oh Woody, please God, no!

dialogues.speaker: HER THUMB
dialogues.text: Hovers over her suit jet toggle control. McConnell's voic from the distance, sounds very tired. Like he's aged fift years in the blink of an eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back, Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri's thumb is still poised. Death would be better.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Outside the REMO. The hatch is still open. We see Phil in staring out anxiously towards Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, simply) He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees no movement from the distant, small figure of Ter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Terri... (long beat) We need you.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI'S THUMB
dialogues.text: Pushes the toggle control... to one side, not forward.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI'S FACE
dialogues.text: Inside her helmet, is streaming with tears. She turns her around, reluctantly. Heads slowly back towards the REMO.

dialogues.speaker: INT. INTERNATIONAL SPACE STATION. MMCR. DAY
dialogues.text: On the big screen at MMCR, a glowing green icon labelled  "MARS RECOVERY" is shown in orbit, as a stream of compute figures crawls beside it.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER TITLE
dialogues.text: Beck stands by the NEW CAPCOM, as the latter repeats head data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, they're Go for the burn and  MOI. Should be initiating the burn  just about... now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the data stream goes crazy. It shivers, streaks, breaks up... then stops. The blinking green icon represen Mars Recovery glows brighter... then vanishes. A moment of stunned silence in the big room. Then a risin babble of scared, confused voices.

dialogues.speaker: RAY BECK
dialogues.text: Takes a step forward, staring helplessly at the screen. H face goes pale, stricken. His worst nightmare is taking p right before his eyes -- and for the second mission in a  row...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. REMO. MARS ORBIT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The REMO is now on the night side of Mars. Cargo boxes,  packing cases and assorted equipment containers float out The hatch is sealed.

dialogues.speaker: INT. REMO. MARS ORBIT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: McConnell hovers by a bulkhead. He's anguished, haunted b the image of Woody's death. We see him struggling to over his grief and shock, trying to force himself to concentra on the critical tasks at hand. In front of him, a panel h been opened; he's facing

dialogues.speaker: SMALL UTILITY MONITOR
dialogues.text: Already glowing, surrounded by coded switches, indicator  lights, com ports.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Stares at these, thinking hard, remembering. He's holding palm-sized computer, already wired into this panel. He be tapping the keys, but then stops himself. Reconsiders. He turns, looking back at

dialogues.speaker: TERRI AND PHIL
dialogues.text: Hunched on what would be the floor if the REMO were on la They grip stowage straps to keep from drifting. Clearly t tiny, rude cargo craft was never designed for manned  operation. It's claustrophobic, bitterly cold.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL'S FACE
dialogues.text: Is a map of torment. He is shivering, both from cold and  fear, barely holding himself together. He hugs his comput supply case like a scared child would hug a teddy bear.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: Is worse. A thousand-yard stare. She's in shock.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Knows he has to occupy them. Speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil? (no response) Hey, Phil...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil looks up at him dully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going in blind. We'll deploy  the chutes by laptop. I need to get  on the data bus, put in a software  patch, and try to soften this tin  can's landing. I could use your help  with the patch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment Phil releases his strap, pushes towards  McConnell. He stares numbly at the monitor for a few beat then takes the little computer from McConnell. He begins tap the keys, slowly at first, but then with more confide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great. Good job. (turning to Terri) Hey, Terri, I was wondering. Think  maybe we could rig some kind of  seatbelts out of those cargo straps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri hesitates a moment, then looks at the strap in her  hand, as if she's never seen it before. Dully she reaches for another one, begins looping them together.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Studies both of their faces intently. Knows that he can't push them too hard, too fast. They're moving like robots, but at least they're moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small thrusters are firing, getting the REMO into positio for entry into the atmosphere. Then all the jets fire in unison, braking the REMO, as it falls away from us, towards Mars at night.

dialogues.speaker: INT. REMO. HIGH ATMOSPHERE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The astronauts, restrained on the floor by Terri's jury-r strap system, hold on for dear life. The buffeting throug the atmosphere is shaking them violently.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THEIR FACEPLATES
dialogues.text: We see the effect of the incredible g-forces: faces disto unable to focus their eyes. Each of them thinking, once a Now I'm going to die...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS ONE BASE CAMP. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The Mars One Base Camp looms in the foreground, like some desolate, otherwordly ghost town. And then, in the night beyond it, we see an eerie and beautiful sight: a bright  streak of red as the REMO slashes down into the Martian  atmosphere, like a shooting star, finally disappearing be distant mountains. Then all is stillness again, deathly  stillness and silence...

dialogues.speaker: INT. INTERNATIONAL SPACE STATION. VIEWPORT. DAY
dialogues.text: Beck stands by a viewport, staring out into space. He's j lost four good friends, and also knows he is seeing, in t disaster, the probable end of the Mars Program, and the  certain end of his own career. He doesn't, at first, even hear the nearby VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray...? We've got some new data,  just coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck looks up, his eyes red-rimmed. The CapCom shifts  uneasily. He's holding a computer printout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just -- it doesn't make any sense.  We're not sure how to read this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Telemetry reports the REMO  has left its orbit and reached the  Martian surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Crashed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. Under power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck snatches the paper, staring at it. For the first tim we see some life coming back into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty-three minutes after Mars  Recovery went off-line. Sir, the  graph reads like a controlled descent.  But that doesn't make any --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck suddenly understands. And it's a joy to see his face the tears of happiness that spring into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They used the REMO as a lander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CapCom stares back at him, feeling the same surge of  hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's McConnell, it's got to be! Nobody  else could have pulled this off. Son  of a bitch! They're alive.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we see the Mars One Base Camp: silent, very still. In distance, the massive ERV still looms, perched for takeof the bottom rungs of its ladder buried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that sand has drifted high against the Hab, as wel as the sides of the partially-deflated tunnel and greenho and the four-man rover. The oxygen still and propellant p are almost buried. Solar panels, some of them punctured b micrometeors, FLAP and CREAK eerily in the slight breeze. And finally,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the camp's American flag, still on its toppled pol but nearly obliterated by sand.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL, TERRI, AND PHIL
dialogues.text: Who are spooked by this desolation. They've paused at the edge of the camp. They have dragged along with them from their landing site crude sledge, improvised from the REMO's hatch cover and  some cargo straps. On this, their meager supplies. McConnell, glancing at the others, knows he's got to keep their spirits up. He kneels, digs out the flag pole. Brus off the sand, he rights this and re-plants it firmly in t ground, packing the sand down with his boot. He stands fo moment looking at the flag, his eyes moist. Despite the c they have made it to Mars. When he turns, Terri and Phil are looking at him, moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Damn right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri, let's see if that oxygen still  is operational. Phil, you better  check out the ERV. I'll take the  Hab. If you find Luke's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches himself. Phil and Terri look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep in touch.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ERV. DAY
dialogues.text: Phil steps from the umber sand onto the ERV's ladder, beg to climb. The four-man rover is nearby, sand drifted high against its tires.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OXYGEN STILL. DAY
dialogues.text: Terri kneels by the oxygen still, begins to scoop away sa with her gloved hands. She still looks numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) I'm at the main airlock door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unlatches a panel, grips the emergency lever inside, t it. After a seeming eternity, the door groans and creaks  open. Little puffs of dust and sand swirl about, settle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering Hab.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ERV. DAY
dialogues.text: Perched atop the ERV's ladder, Phil, using a battery-powe drill, is just removing the final screw from the hatch co He lifts off the heavy cover, lets it tumble to the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got ERV access. I'm going in.  Terri, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OXYGEN STILL. DAY
dialogues.text: Terri is still scooping sand. She's just cleared the firs row of gauges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. This is gonna take awhile to  get back to 100% capacity.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS ONE HAB. DAY
dialogues.text: McConnell walks through the kitchen, which we recognize. pauses to look at the table from which Luke and his crew  taped their final, fateful message.

dialogues.speaker: HIS BIRTHDAY CUPCAKE
dialogues.text: Still sits there, eerily, with its stub of burned-out can Half-finished, frozen cups of coffee. Suddenly, out of th corner of his eye, he catches a flash of white. He spins, startled, and sees HIS OWN REFLECTION. In his white pressure suit, staring back at him from the  screen of a video monitor. Above this is perched the came the Mars One astronauts used for their comm packets.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL SHIVERS
dialogues.text: This place is filled with ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ERV COCKPIT. DAY
dialogues.text: Phil, in the pilot's seat of the ERV, pushes a computer's power button. The screen flickers weakly to life, startli him a bit, but all he sees on it are white streaks, crazy static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERV appears structurally intact.  Computers are fried, just as we  thought.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OXYGEN STILL. DAY
dialogues.text: Terri has cleared more gauges, valves. She sits back on h heels, studying the tangle of pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that. I've got busted filters  here, clogged intakes. Helluva cleanup  job, but so far no major damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a fantastic, almost jungle-like atmosphere. The plants have been allowed -- encouraged? -- to grow wildly. Some even pushing against the inflated roof. Water condenses o the leaves and the roof, then is captured and routed thro pipes of every shape and size, dripping into a clever  assortment of collection jars. Liquid water.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Reaches into a bucket, touches the water. His glove comes before his wondering eyes, dripping. Grasping the implica he looks down at his forearm instrument pad. Blinking red letters read "25 deg. C." And something else the puffy white material of his suit is starting to sligh deflate, revealing his arm's shape. There's air pressure here!

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Punches in more numbers, and gets the readout: "Nitr. 78%/ 02 20%/ C02 1%/ Trace gasses 1%."

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Slowly reaches up, unsealing the neck ring of his helmet. hesitates, then lifts it off. Takes a deep, quenching lun of pure air. Holds it in. Lets it slowly out. For a momen he doesn't trust his own voice. Then speaks softly toward his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the greenhouse. You better...  you better come see this for  yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ERV. DAY
dialogues.text: Phil, still sitting at the cockpit controls, turns. Throu a side viewport he can just make out the greenhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no answer. He rises.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OXYGEN STILL. DAY
dialogues.text: Terri rises, concerned, and turns. Through the distant,  translucent wall of the greenhouse, McConnell's shadowy f can be seen, moving slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim...?

dialogues.speaker: INT. GREENHOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: McConnell sets down his helmet, starts exploring, pushing through fronds as he makes his way down an aisle. The dri foliage is so dense it almost chokes his path. Everywhere looks, he has the sense of a scrounged-together, recycled jury-rigged environment, where a great deal of ingenuity come into play. He pauses, looking up... Overhead, a bellows, stitched together from pieces of pla tarp, slowly inhales and exhales, pumping air into a vent the upper deck of the Hab. Its power comes from a crude w wheel, a buckets-and-strut assemblage, tidily sutured wit duct tape, like some giant Erector set. As McConnell turns away from this, still marvelling, a ra figure leaps through the foliage! It smashes into him, wi a HARSH SCREECH, knocking him to the ground. McConnell, on his back, straddled by his attacker, fights back as best he can. A blur of flailing arms and fists, a he tries to push the creature away. Staring up, he catche glimpse of the almost unrecognizable

dialogues.speaker: LUKE GRAHAM
dialogues.text: Whose frightened eyes glare back at him through a swaying curtain of dreadlocks. His skin is creased, weathered, ab a scraggly beard. His clothes are tattered, patched toget In one fist he grips a rock hammer, which he swings high  overhead, about to drive the claw through McConnell's sku McConnell grabs his arm desperately, trying to fend him o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, it's me! Jim McConnell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a flash of uncertainty in Luke's eyes. Then he yan his arm free, and his hammer arcs up even higher, tremble in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, it's Jim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, you're not... you can't be  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife is Debra! Your son is Bobby!  You were reading Treasure Island  with him...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he stares down at McConnell, Luke's eyes finally light with recognition. but before he can move, he is seized fr behind and flung backwards to the ground, the hammer ripp from his grasp, as Terri and Phil pinion his arms. McConn scrambles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell kneels beside Luke, signalling to Terri and Phi that it's okay to let him go. They stand back, pulling of their helmets. Everyone is panting, out of breath. Luke sits up, slowly studying their features, one after  another, as if still not quite certain whether they might vanish. His voice is hoarse, rusty from disuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil... Terri...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks with incomprehension at McConnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim... I don't understand. You're  not supposed to be here... Why are  you here? Where's Woody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't make it Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stares at McConnell, trying to absorb everything. He looks to Terri, who looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke shakes his head in dismay. He seems to shrink in on  himself. It's all too much for him to take in. McConnell  kneels and puts his arm around Luke, comforting him.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ELSEWHERE IN THE GREENHOUSE. DAY, (MINUTES LATER)
dialogues.text: Luke sits on the side of his cot, in the little tented  sleeping area he's created in one corner of the greenhous Nearby, his hotplate, pots, and some freshly harvested  vegetables and greens. The others crouch around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, what happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flash of fear in Luke's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) We fired the radar. It came. They  all died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What came?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all died, but I was spared.  Why? Had to be for a reason. Then,  all of a sudden, I knew why I was  spared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice drops to a conspiratorial whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So somebody would be left to figure  out the secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps his forehead, significantly, then nods once or tw The others exchange an uneasy glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, we still don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. Comecomecome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises quickly and scuttles off, waving an impatient ha without waiting to see if they'll follow. McConnell, Terr and Phil stare after him for a long moment. Phil breaks t silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it just me? Or is he about two  mealpacks short of a picnic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long term exposure to low gravity  can have an adverse impact on the  brain. He could be suffering from a  form of asphyxia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe his whole crew died and  he's been marooned alone on Mars.  Let's give him time to adjust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell and Terri follow in the direction Luke went. Ph trailing, mutters to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greatgreatgreat.
