dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS ONE BASE CAMP. DAY
dialogues.text: Luke, now in a patched-up pressure suit and grubby-lookin helmet, stands peering down unhappily at the improvised  sledge, with its meager supplies. McConnell, Terri, and P walk up behind him, wearing their helmets again. They hea Luke over his RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... let me be sure I understand  this. Your ship blew up, with all  its supplies. Then you emptied the  cargo out of the REMO, and it was  totalled on landing. You've got no  food, no water, no spare oxygen,  nothing but what I see here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell and the others are silent, embarrassed. Then  McConnell nods. Luke looks at him, a cracked grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda rescue mission is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the computer repair case, as Phil lifts it o a sledge. Luke turns, looks at the case, then Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out. New nav boards for the  ERV. I got four round-trip tickets,  baby, right in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In some mysterious way, this reminder of Woody's death se to bring him fully back into himself. He takes Terri by t shoulders, deeply saddened. She meets his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri... I'm so sorry. He was a good  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When there's time, we'll talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, grateful. A beat. He looks at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts off across the sand, and they follow.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GRAVE SITE. DAY
dialogues.text: They stand looking down at the three long mounds of dirt, Luke completes his account of the disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...When I came to and dug myself out  of the sand, my faceplate was cracked.  Leaking badly. I barely made it back  to Base. It was weeks before I could  work up the nerve to go back out  there and look for their...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to pause, collect himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee was the only one I could find.  But it didn't seem right, somehow,  to dig just one grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an emotional silence. Luke turns, takes a few st He stares into the distance, observing the swirling dust  around them. McConnell hesitates, notices Luke's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has it been blowing like this for a  while? (Luke nods) We saw a big storm from space. But  Micker said it was turning south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks off into the distance, studies something only seems to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it holds course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell pulls his gaze away from the horizon, looks at  Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This -- whatever it was -- this force.  You say it came directly out of the  top of the mountain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me. That's okay.  But I'm not crazy, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell isn't quite sure how to reply to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you mean by its "secret?"  What secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) You better see for yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS ONE HAB. DAY
dialogues.text: McConnell, Terri, and Phil follow Luke into the Science L area of the Hab, then stop in their tracks. Their helmets are off. It's very cold in here; their breath is frosty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lab is crammed with rock and sand samples from many  locations, all tagged and labelled. There are drawings an diagrams covering the walls: Martian landscapes, annotate maps, and over and over, obsessively repeated, drawings o the vortex that destroyed the Mars One crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, where they made their mistake  was, they must've planned for it to  be visible from Earth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others turn, looking at him. Luke is aiming an electr space heater at his computer. As the coils glow red, he r his hands together, poised over the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's "they"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke reacts to their blank stares. He has a kind of jitte feverish intensity, a secret excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you understand? Hundreds of  millions of years have gone by. You've  got erosion, sand storms, lava flows,  meteor impacts -- hell, in that much  time, the whole surface would've  changed. So no wonder we never saw  it before. Well, I mean, we saw it,  but not like they meant us too. Too  much dirt on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others exchange worried glances. Is he totally nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the computer screen they're looking at...

dialogues.speaker: THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: Pictures of the Face after the disaster, seen from ground level, in telephoto views. Rising out of a ring of rock a dirt rubble is the shiny-white profile of a gigantic face The white is smooth, impenetrable. It has the scale of a  mountain, but the planes and angles are clearly unnatural

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL, PHIL AND TERRI, (INT. MARS ONE HAB.)
dialogues.text: They are stunned. Can hardly believe their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But whatever it is,  somebody built it. And not us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few moments of silence while they try to absorb this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the sound? That signal  you heard before the explosion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, Jim, good. That's the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A click of the mouse and they all HEAR, over speakers, th DEEP PULSING BASS TONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear the pauses? That's what made me  realize it's a pattern -- a repeating  pattern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mathematical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is trembling with excitement. His words tumble out v quickly. He's been waiting so long to share this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. There are  distinct blocks in the pattern, and  within each block the tones come in  groups of three. Threethreethree.  For months I struggled to analyze  it, trying different constructs...  Then I thought about dimensions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: X-Y-Z coordinates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! Three groups equals three  dimensions... So I tried assigning  different graphic values to each  block, group and tone. And finally I  got... this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He types another command. They all look at the monitor, t glow reflecting on their faces. They are amazed again.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: Where we see the beautiful interlocking chain, the univer familiar double helix, of a DNA molecule -- the elegant  blueprint of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God... Is that what I think it  is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DNA... that's a model of DNA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see it, too. Thank God. I was  afraid I was just suffering from a  form of asphyxia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at him, surprised that he overheard her earli diagnosis. But he smiles, not offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, okay, so -- somebody left this  thing here, somebody -- other than  human. But what the hell is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guess is, it's a signature. A  self-portrait of whatever species  created the Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that DNA looks human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. It's missing the last pair  of chromosomes. See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's close. Damn close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The difference between a man and an  ape is less than three percent of  genetic material. But that three  percent gives you Mozart. Einstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Jack the Ripper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at him. Then all four turn, stare again at the  slowly rotating DNA, pondering its awesome mystery.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: When he finally speaks, never takes his eyes off the scre We can read in them the almost overwhelming grip this mys has on his imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a long day. Let's get a  couple hours sleep, then tackle this  thing when we're fresher. Phil, your  first priority will be to get the  motherboards over to the ERV.  Concentrate on getting communications  up first. (Phil nods) Soon as we've got the juice, we'll  send a packet to Micker, tell them  Luke's OK, and that... everything  else that's happened. The rest of us  will take an inventory of supplies,  see where we stand. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others nod in weary agreement. As they start out, tow the relative warmth of the greenhouse, Terri looks at Luk at his scraggly beard and his long, lank hair. She smiles brushing some locks off his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. There's a pair of scissors in  my medkit.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS ONE HAB. ANOTHER SECTION. NEXT MORNING
dialogues.text: As in the Science Area, this space has enough thin oxygen for the astronauts to remain unhelmeted. McConnell and Lu are still going through what few supplies were salvaged f the REMO. Luke pauses, rubbing the unfamiliar smoothness of his che His beard is gone, his hair neatly trimmed. McConnell enj Luke's own wonder at his transformation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I just got back my other three  percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell smiles. Terri enters through the hatch, removin her helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The backup generator is salvageable,  and two of the solar panels. I'm  pretty sure I can get the oxygen  still back into production, too. So  we're not in such bad shape,  considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work, Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell, rummaging through Phil's backpack, drops an al opened bag of M&Ms. The CANDIES scatter and bounce al the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that. Phil's idea of absolute  essentials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Terri smile. McConnell scoops up the fallen M&am He slows down as he does it, looking at the scatter of li round CANDIES. Something tugging at the back of his mind.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS RECOVERY. EVA AIRLOCK. DAY
dialogues.text: Phil's intricately designed M&M model of his "ideal w floating weightlessly, as McConnell drifts past it, pluck away a couple pieces of the candy. Phil reacting, in good natured annoyance. The gap in the design left by McConnel theft...

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: As he trembles with excitement. With sudden comprehension

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a signature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That noise from the Face... It's not  a signature. It's a test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Terri stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS ONE HAB. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: McConnell sits in front of the computer back in the scien lab area, staring once again at the mysterious DNA model. Luke and Terri stand behind him. McConnell's energy, his certainty, is almost electrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's asking us for the right answer.  It wants us to put in the missing  pair of chromosomes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To prove that we're human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri and Luke look at each other, starting to understand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fired radar into that thing.  Concentrated sound waves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which it interpreted as a wrong  answer... Yes! It's like a, a security  alarm. When it gets an incorrect  response, it defends itself.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ERV COCKPIT. DAY
dialogues.text: Phil is listening in on radio. He's got panels open, wire dangling, as he works his ongoing repair. He keys his mik uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happens when it gets the  right answer?

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS ONE HAB. DAY
dialogues.text: As McConnell looks at Luke and Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates) I don't know. But we've got to find  out. (to Luke, pointing) Can you work this the other way?  Figure out which tones would be  equivalent to the missing chromosomes?  Then dub them into your recording of  the signal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the radar gun? Will it  accept that input? Can we transmit a  completed signal back to the Face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stares at him, startled by what he's implying.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ERV COCKPIT. DAY
dialogues.text: Phil is also growing increasingly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, hold on, Jim. What if  you're wrong? Whoever goes out  there... I mean, what if you're wrong?  Three people have already died over  that thing.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS ONE HAB. DAY
dialogues.text: As Luke and Terri look tensely at McConnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri, if we leave here without  getting some answers, they all died  in vain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just don't know enough about that --  that thing out there to take any  more chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we here for, if not to take  chances...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His passion startles them; they've never seen him so  emotional. He points at the computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This means we're not alone. It means  we're on the brink of the greatest  discovery in mankind's history. But  we've still got to prove it. Who  knows when someone else will get  back here? Or if they ever will? You  know what Congress is like. They'll  say it's too dangerous, too much  loss of life, let's go back to  unmanned flights. We could be the  last explorers to come here for  decades. We're it, guys. (pause) We're it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) We don't have to go out there. There's  a better way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS. THE FACE. PLAINS OF CYDONIA. DAY
dialogues.text: The familiar, plucky little figure of ARES-8 wheels acros ocher sand, with the radar gun jury-rigged onto its back. Ares' video snout WHIRRS out, extending. The familiar bas rumble of the Face is very loud from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking video feed...

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS ONE HAB. LATE DAY
dialogues.text: McConnell, Terri, and Phil have gathered around Luke as h pushes buttons, and a monitor CRACKLES to life. White str then a blurry image, which he tries to enhance. Finally t image starts to sharpen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: They see the familiar stark white profile of the FACE, sh from ground level, in a SLOWLY APPROACHING ANGLE...

dialogues.speaker: THE FOUR ASTRONAUTS
dialogues.text: Stare at the ominous sight. They're all more nervous than they want to show. Luke's fingers delicately work a joyst as he maneuvers the remote surveyor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How close do we need to get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. Maybe we better stop  by that boulder.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS. THE FACE. LATE DAY
dialogues.text: Ares-8 whines to a stop by a large boulder, which partial shields it from the Face, looming beyond. The radar gun  swivels, locating its target. Then stops, ready to fire.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS ONE HAB. LATE DAY
dialogues.text: Luke looks at Terri, Phil, and McConnell. Phil shuts the of the box holding the new nav boards, snaps it protectiv down. He nods. Terri takes a deep breath, then she nods. Luke's hand hovers over the red firing button; a moment o awesome uncertainty and danger. He looks at McConnell, wh finally gives a nod of command. Then Luke hits the button

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS. THE FACE. LATE DAY
dialogues.text: From the radar gun on Ares-8's back, a sharp, high-pitche electronic burst is emitted, pulsating like a tuning fork it's fired towards the Face. After a few seconds it stops For a moment nothing happens. Then the deep bass rumbling stops as well. The only remai sound is of WIND, stirring up dust on the Martian plains.

dialogues.speaker: THE FACE
dialogues.text: As suddenly a huge, curved segment of the white surface b to rise from the earth, like a gigantic hangar door, slid out of sight into an upper sheath of some kind. The movem is measured, stately, utterly silent. As the segment rise it reveals a blinding white light: the interior of the Fa No inside details can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARS ONE HAB. DAY
dialogues.text: McConnell, Luke, Terri and Phil stare at this phenomenon, awed. They're barely breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked... It worked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check for radiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke punches buttons, waits anxiously for a readout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normal. Seismic... normal. Anemometer  steady. No sign of the vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what we did, but guys --  does that look to you like a hostile  gesture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. More like an invitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or another test...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell is staring at the mysterious opening. On his fa a growing look of determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, the four-man rover. Does it  still work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others look at him, their expressions changing as the realize what he's implying.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS ONE BASE CAMP. LATE DAY
dialogues.text: McConnell, once again helmeted, emerges from the Hab airl Luke, Terri and Phil are coming out behind him. The wind picked up, and fine dust is blowing. They stop, staring o in astonishment towards

dialogues.speaker: A FRIGHTENING SIGHT
dialogues.text: The entire sky has darkened from its customary salmon int purplish-black at the horizon, with bloody streaks above. The DUST STORM has turned their way; it's now sixty kilom away and closing. The main body of it reaches two thousan meters above the surface and stretches out along a thousa kilometer front.

dialogues.speaker: THE ASTRONAUTS
dialogues.text: Stare at this unholy juggernaut, alarmed. McConnell turns Luke, whose expression is grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long before it hits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour? Maybe less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A storm like that? It could go  planetary. And last a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll sock us in, Jim. We won't be  able to take off. If that happens,  with what few supplies we've got  left...? We'll starve to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell turns, staring off towards the killer storm. Th others look at him with questioning gazes. He turns again There's the four-man rover, ready to go. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil, how much longer to prep the  ERV?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe forty-five minutes. It'll be  tight, but we can make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there's still time for us to  get out there and back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks a question at Luke and Terri, one after the othe Their eyes, tense but excited, signal agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here. Continue the repair. If  something goes wrong, you get out of  here before that storm hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back... alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're not back in forty-five  minutes, I want you to prep and  launch. (looks at his armpad  display) That's 1950 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a suggestion, it's an order.  You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) I understand. But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not back by 1950, I prep  and launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell nods, satisfied. Looks at Terri and Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start towards the four-man rover. Dust is swirling m thickly through the air, and the WIND IS LOUDER NOW. Phil stands watching them go, a lone, rather forlorn figure.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PLAINS OF CYDONIA. DUSK
dialogues.text: In a WIDE SHOT, we see the rover approaching the Face, ac the plains. The sky beyond the Face is almost black, as t storm approaches from that direction. It's marching  relentlessly across the planet, with flashes of lightning now rippling up and down its face, and even small tornado spinning off near its purple-black base...

dialogues.speaker: INT. ERV COCKPIT. DUSK
dialogues.text: Phil has panels off. He's reaching into the guts of the m computer, working feverishly. His repair kit is beside hi

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS. THE FACE. DUSK
dialogues.text: In a HIGH SHOT, we look down across the side of the Face its vast, open doorway, out of which the bright white lig is streaming. Into this corridor of light, we see the rov arrive, slewing to a stop, throwing sand from its wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at the cavernous vertical gap in the side of the  Face. The opening towers to a dizzying height above us; t white light strains our eyes. The three astronauts ENTER  FRAME as we see them, from behind, staring up.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ASTRONAUTS' AWED FACES
dialogues.text: As they are stunned by the immensity of the scene, the co mystery before them. Luke and Terri look at McConnell. An moment of critical decision. He keys his mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil, do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: INT. ERV COCKPIT. DUSK
dialogues.text: Phil keys his own mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Jim. Your signal's breaking up  a little in the storm, but I read  you.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE FACE. DUSK
dialogues.text: McConnell stares into the bright opening. Bathed in its l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at the Face. We're gonna need  a few minutes here. Same deadline,  launch at 1950. With or without us.  Do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Copy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri and Luke exchange a tense glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, are you sure you want to do  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure of anything anymore.  But I didn't come a hundred million  miles just to turn back in the last  ten feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke smiles. The three of them stare into the portal.  McConnell, between the others, reaches out and grips each them by a gloved hand. They take a sort of collective bre Then they walk forward together, into the light.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE FACE. DUSK
dialogues.text: The astronauts continue forward, each of them extending a free hand. The light is too dazzling for them to gauge distances,  textures, colors -- anything at all. They can't see walls ceiling, even a floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surface seems firm and level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that. Texture is smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got good footing and no  obstructions. Let's check our --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, there is an abrupt WHOOOSH, like a giant air sealing shut. They turn, startled and nervous. Letting go each other's hands, Luke and Terri run back the way they  came, but almost immediately are stopped by a wall of som sort. The vast hangar-type door has closed behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's solid again! We're trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! Keep this orientation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three scared, helmeted faces seem to float in the  brightness, some twenty feet apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys his mike) Phil? Phil, can you still hear me?

dialogues.speaker: INT. ERV COCKPIT. DUSK
dialogues.text: Phil, saying a silent prayer, reaches over and turns on t main computer. It works! He's immensely relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computers are online! Ready to load  software. But guys -- we're losing  visibility here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances out the cockpit window at the blowing dust. Th realizes that he's hearing only silence over his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys...? Jim? Luke? Terri? Is anyone  there...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Phil stares at his radio in dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FACE. DUSK
dialogues.text: McConnell is staring at his spacesuit's sleeve. He can se that the suit material is starting to deflate, revealing shape of his arm, just as it did in Luke's greenhouse. He hesitates, then begins to unscrew the sealing ring on his right glove. Terri and Luke see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Jim, what're you doing? You'll  depressurize!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell makes the final twist on his glove and there's hiss of rushing air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, seal it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That was air going into my suit,  not out. Look at your own suits --  they're not rigid anymore. We've got  pressure in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks at his sleeve. McConnell's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above Mars atmospheric? That's  impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're millions of miles from Earth  and we're inside a gigantic white  face. What's impossible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri types on her arm keypad. She's amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's six psi in here... (taps more keys) Nitrogen and oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otherwise known as air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri nods. McConnell starts unscrewing his helmet ring.  Luke follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there may be some lethal trace  gasses I haven't picked up yet, or...  or... oh, the hell with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri starts taking off her helmet. In a few moments, all three helmets are off. They hold them, glowing softly, ag their chests, as they breathe deeply and gratefully. Air. And then, at this very moment, as if they have just passe another kind of test...

dialogues.speaker: HIGH, STRIATED WALL
dialogues.text: Appears through the glare, soaring up before their startl eyes. White, metallic, composed of complexly-linked bands plates, ramps. It's part of a STRUCTURE whose overall hei and breadth keep us from understanding its purpose. But t hatch opening slowly in its side, at the top of an approa ramp, is unmistakable. Radiant white light streams out fr within, forming a glowing tunnel, down towards the astron

dialogues.speaker: THE ASTRONAUTS BLINK
dialogues.text: Raising their gloves against the dazzling glow. At the en of this tunnel of light, inside the hatch frame

dialogues.speaker: A SHAPE MATERIALIZES
dialogues.text: And slowly resolves itself into a glowing humanoid form,  which we somehow sense is female. She appears benign,  wondrous. This glowing MARTIAN -- a holograph -- regards astronauts for a few moments, then beckons to them, as if say "Enter." All her motions are both calm and calming -- precise, unhurried, gracious.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL, LUKE AND TERRI
dialogues.text: Look at each other. They're awed into silence, and still  tense, but now more out of excitement and anticipation th fear. Their eyes agree: Let's go. They walk forward slowly, carrying their helmets, up the  ramp and into the tunnel of light, following the Martian, who retreats before them. They go through the hatch and  disappear inside.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARTIAN STRUCTURE. DUSK
dialogues.text: Following the Martian, they find themselves in a round, o space, defined by light, with a smooth matte-metallic flo but without apparent walls. The Martian stops, turns, facing them. The astronauts sto too, uncertain what they're meant to do. Then the Martian gestures again. A cylindrical holographic column appears, rising from the floor in front of the astronauts. Inside it, a swirl of e lights, millions of them, like cosmic fireflies...

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL, LUKE, AND TERRI
dialogues.text: Set down their helmets, then cautiously converge around t column, forming a loose triangle. As they stare into it, myriad lights are reflected off their own eyes and their  spacesuits.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HOLOGRAPHIC COLUMN
dialogues.text: The whirling lights resolve into images, which relate to  them the story of ancient Mars:

dialogues.speaker: A BLUE PLANET
dialogues.text: we do not recognize. All is peaceful, beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Is that what I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's Mars.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY A HUGE ASTEROID
dialogues.text: Tumbles through space towards the planet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PLANET
dialogues.text: As thousands of small rocketships lift away from the surf heading in a stream out of the solar system...

dialogues.speaker: THE ASTEROID IMPACTS
dialogues.text: And a wall of fire and debris scours the planet. Oceans b and vaporize. Two gigantic hunks are blasted out of the  planet, spinning in flames...

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL, LUKE, AND TERRI
dialogues.text: Involuntarily flinch, bathed in the fiery images...

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANET IS NOW DEAD
dialogues.text: As dust storms roil across its cold, lifeless surface. Th flaming hunks of molten rock cool into twin moons.

dialogues.speaker: THE ASTRONAUTS
dialogues.text: Stare at this devastation, deeply moved.

dialogues.speaker: IN DEEP SPACE
dialogues.text: The stream of Martian ships grows smaller and smaller as continues on its epic voyage towards a new solar system.  Then we zero in on

dialogues.speaker: ONE PARTICULAR ROCKETSHIP
dialogues.text: As it peels off and goes in another direction. Graphics s a model of what the ship contains: the familiar double he of DNA. The ship heads towards another blue planet in our solar system...

dialogues.speaker: EARTH
dialogues.text: As it was then. More clouds than now, more ocean, and the landforms all wedged together.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: Her voice is soft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth, when it was still Pangaea.  Before the continents separated.

dialogues.speaker: THE LONE MARTIAN SHIP
dialogues.text: Makes a fiery streak through Earth's atmosphere and plung into the ocean. Instantly the image of the DNA double helix grows, fillin the entire holographic column, then it begins to spin and pulse, disintegrating into a phantasmagoric whirl of new  images...

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL, LUKE, AND TERRI
dialogues.text: Cry out, stunned by the strobelike power of the display a

dialogues.speaker: LIVING FORMS
dialogues.text: Flash into the holographic column, swimming, growing,  crawling, leaping, flying: one-celled microscopic organis plankton, plants of all kinds, insects, then fish, dinosa birds, small mammals, larger mammals -- the entire stunni panorama of evolution, distilled into a single explosive  sequence, as the images wash over the dazzled, awestruck

dialogues.speaker: FACES OF THE ASTRONAUTS
dialogues.text: Until finally the images whirl away, the holographic colu dissolves, leaving only a circle of glowing, concentric,  colored rings on the floor. The astronauts are left stari at each other across the open space where the column had  been.

dialogues.speaker: THE MARTIAN
dialogues.text: Now comes forward with outstretched arms and completes th circle, taking the fourth position. McConnell is opposite her glowing form, and Terri and Luke are at either side. Martian reaches her arms out, inviting them to link hands As they do so, the Martian seems to be staring directly i McConnell's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Is in wondrous awe, his whole face radiant with joy. It's the first time we've ever seen him utterly without sadnes or reserve. Staring at the Martian, he understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're us. We're them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're Martians...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what she means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. The Cambrian explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell and Luke look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost six hundred million years  ago, there was a sudden expansion of  life on Earth. The first multi-celled  plants and animals appeared. No one  has ever understood why...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They seeded Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a BELL-LIKE TONE, a single lingering high note, a simultaneously the outermost ring of the circle on the fl begins to glow brightly. It is an intense chromium yellow

dialogues.speaker: THE ASTRONAUTS
dialogues.text: Step back, startled, unlinking their hands, and look at t circle of colored rings. These shade from yellow, on the  outer rim, to a deeper yellow, then orange, then finally  reds. Inside the final, deep red ring is a circle of indi blue, about a meter across. Small points of light glitter here, like stars against a midnight sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE MARTIAN
dialogues.text: Steps closer to McConnell. She has picked him out in  particular. Now she beckons for him to move inside the ci of colored rings, to stand on the indigo core.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Looks back at her, nods his understanding. For the first  time she seems to smile. Benevolence, reassurance. Then a abruptly as she first appeared, she fades away. Vanishes. Luke and Terri look at McConnell, confused. There is a su static-filled CRACKLE from their helmets, nearby on the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) ...in, please. Can you... me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri picks up her helmet, leans into its mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil, we're here! We read you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even through the scratchy interference, they can hear the relief in Phil's voice. And then the desperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God! Listen, this storm is  really -- (loud static) -- few more minutes, I can't -- (more static) You've gotta get back to the ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then they hear only STATIC. His signal is lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil? Phil...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the BELL-LIKE TONE REPEATS, at a lower register, with a more sustained note, and simultaneously, the last the yellow circles of light begins to fade, as

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST ORANGE BAND
dialogues.text: Begins to glow brighter. McConnell turns, looking at this new color, then looks back at Luke and Terri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in a ship. This is a ship.  And the countdown has already started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri looks at Luke, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's get the hell out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scoops up Luke's helmet, tosses it to him. As he catc it, she's already starting back out, in the direction the came from, and Luke follows her. Until they both become a that McConnell isn't with them. They turn back. He's stil rooted to the spot, his gaze locked on the indigo core of the colored rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell doesn't turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, we gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming back, she sees how calm he is. How certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? We've  got to get home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where I'm going. Don't you  see? That's what all this is for. (McConnell gestures  at the ship around  them) You were right Terri. This is an  invitation. To follow them. To follow  them home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks into their faces. Terri is trying to grasp this  idea, still incredulous. Luke has the beginning of a half smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go. This is the mission  now. To find out who we are. Isn't  that why we came here? Like Maggie  said, "To stand on a new world and  look beyond it to the next one."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke nods at the memory of Maggie's words. Terri remember too. McConnell's passionate conviction is affecting them  both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, when you think about it --  I wasn't even supposed to be here --  all the accidents, everything that  got us to this point, it's just...  it's just... I just know it's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri looks at Luke. Luke is smiling. He understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. I know what I'm doing. But  you're running out of time. You've  gotta get back to the ERV and get  off this planet. Now please go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke steps closer, looking at his old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I once felt like I was taking your  turn. But now I think maybe you're  taking mine. Guess I'm a little  jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clasp hands for a moment. But in this moment is a  lifetime of camaraderie, an eternity of farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for saving my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke nods, deeply moved. He turns away, picking up his he as Terri comes closer, looking at McConnell, a long unspo beat. Her eyes are glistening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish Woody were here to see this.  He would've wanted to go too, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri smiles. She is starting on the road to recovery. Sh going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here, Terri. We wouldn't have  made it without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri nods. She digs into one of her suit's pockets, pull something out. She hands it to McConnell, and his fist cl around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McConnell smiles. Terri smiles back at him. Then she turn picks up her helmet, and crosses to where Luke has paused looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jim...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a great ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Terri exchange a final silent farewell with him, then hurry away, into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Looks down at what Terri gave him.

dialogues.speaker: IT'S WOODY'S NECK CHAIN
dialogues.text: With the little Flash Gordon rocketship.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Grips this tightly as he looks up.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS. THE FACE. PLAINS OF CYDONIA. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The hanger-like hatch has reopened, and Luke and Terri,  helmeted again, emerge from the Face. The leading edge of the dust storm is upon them. They can't see much more tha few meters. As they reach the rover, they hear, even in this chaos, t the deep pulsing tone of the Face has started again. They look at each other, uncertain what this means. But McConn is now beyond their help. Luke keys his mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil? Phil, do you read? (to Terri) He's not reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can barely read you. Let's get the  hell out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone there? Can anyone read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil gets no response. He is shaking, almost crying. He  hesitates, then starts hitting some keys.

dialogues.speaker: HIS COMPUTER DISPLAY
dialogues.text: Which reads: "PRE-LAUNCH CHECKLIST."

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARTIAN SPACESHIP. NIGHT
dialogues.text: McConnell has shed his backpack, with its unneeded oxygen tank. He steps cautiously onto the colored rings. Nothing seems to happen. Moving further, he takes his place on th indigo circle at their core. He looks at

dialogues.speaker: THE GLOWING TAKE-OFF COUNTDOWN INDICATOR
dialogues.text: As it dips from orange into red; the BELL TONES are conti now, very deep and rapid.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PLAINS OF CYDONIA. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The rover, with Luke and Terri inside, races away towards the safety of the ERV, as the maelstrom boils over the Fa behind them. The sky is purplish black, thick with flying debris and eerie lightning flashes. Towering billows of d chase them over the plain, nearly enveloping them as they speed towards us, passing OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARTIAN SPACESHIP. NIGHT
dialogues.text: McConnell reacts, surprised, as suddenly

dialogues.speaker: A TRANSPARENT, GLASS-LIKE CYLINDER
dialogues.text: Begins to rise around him, swiftly and smoothly, coming u from the circumference of the indigo circle. Then a second, identical cylinder -- the top half -- drop down from somewhere overhead. The two sections meet and f in a flash of light, containing McConnell inside them, as neatly as if he were in a giant, transparent mailing tube

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Fights against a stab of claustrophobia. Is he being  imprisoned? Or somehow protected? Either way, he's virtua immobilized. In this tight space in his bulky suit, he ca even move his arms. Only his head and neck can still shif

dialogues.speaker: INT. ERV COCKPIT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Phil is going over his final pre-launch checklist, flippi switches and pressing buttons. He looks at his

dialogues.speaker: DIGITAL CLOCK
dialogues.text: Which reads "1350."

dialogues.speaker: PHIL IS STRICKEN, TORMENTED
dialogues.text: His finger hovers over a "Fire" button. He licks his lips nervously, squeezes his eyes shut, and hits the button.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER DISPLAY
dialogues.text: And the words: "IGNITION SEQUENCE INITIATED"

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARTIAN SPACESHIP. NIGHT
dialogues.text: McConnell is straining inside the cylinder that surrounds him, when something catches his attention. He arches his  neck, looking down.

dialogues.speaker: A COBALT-BLUE TRANSPARENT LIQUID
dialogues.text: Is beginning to fill the cylinder! It swirls in, from som unknown source, rising rapidly; already his lower boots a covered.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL'S EYES
dialogues.text: Widen in alarm. He strains against the sides of the cylin but

dialogues.speaker: HIS GLOVED HANDS
dialogues.text: Slide helplessly across the smooth surface.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Looks down again.

dialogues.speaker: THE COBALT LIQUID
dialogues.text: Is up to his knees. Now his thighs...

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Cranes his neck, staring up. Can he wedge himself higher, can he somehow climb to safety?

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE HIM
dialogues.text: The entire "ceiling" of the Face is becoming translucent. can see the dust storm, boiling overhead. And now, rising into this, are fiery coils of energy from the Face itself These swirl and twist in every direction, like angry wate snakes; battered by the fierce winds. Two vast forces on collision course.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ROVER. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Luke drives the rover through the blinding storm, as Terr stares at a dashboard computer screen. They have to shout be heard over the ROARING WIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lost the Base Camp beacon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks over alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: A DIAL
dialogues.text: As the needle spins freely, giving no direction whatsoeve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No good! We're driving blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to keep on a straight line!  It's our only chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry! I've worked with Phil  for four years! I know Jim gave him  a direct order, but he won't leave  without us.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PLAINS OF CYDONIA. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The Rover races towards us, the front of the storm chasin it from behind, then completely overtaking the Rover. It  disappears from view!

dialogues.speaker: INT. ERV COCKPIT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Phil sits in the pilot's seat. He is looking at a compute graphic that shows the engines readying to launch. With  resignation, he keys his mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ERV, do you read? ERV to  Rover, do you read...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil waits a second, then reaches slowly for a blinking r switch that reads "LAUNCH." He hesitates, then actually h his fingers on it, about to flip it, when he hears a crac of static on the radio. Phil keys his mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ERV, do you read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very faint) Save the fuel, Phil. We're coming  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Phil chokes back a sob. Blinking back the tears, he t to compose himself, then keys his mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Phil's not here right now. He  left for Earth five minutes ago.  Please leave your message at the  beep.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE FACE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: FROM GROUND LEVEL we see that the coils of energy are ris from the forehead of the Face, from its "third eye," spin and looping faster and faster, starting to form a vortex. But unlike the wind vortex that killed the Mars One crew, this is a vortex of fire. As we watch, more fiery streaks begin to emerge from the sides of the Face, from the chin cheeks and temples. These all rush upwards, like lava flo uphill, gathering in intensity as they leap free of the F itself and spiral into the atmosphere. The peak of the fo vortex is already piercing the lowest layer of storm clou causing a dark counter-swirl.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS ONE BASE CAMP. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Phil stands at the bottom of the ERV's ladder, gripping i to steady himself, staring into the swirling dust. THE ROVER appears out of the dust and sand, the immense s seeming to chase it from behind. Luke and Terri climb out struggle towards him through the wind. Phil grips their h helping them over to the ladder. He looks back, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got another ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil stares at her, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you on the way. Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARTIAN SHIP. NIGHT
dialogues.text: LOOKING DOWN INTO THE CYLINDER, we see that the cobalt-bl fluid has risen to McConnell's upper chest. Now it's at h shoulders! It pours into his suit through his neck ring. He strains on tiptoes, craning his head back, trying to k his unhelmeted face above the rising liquid. He sucks in deep desperate gulps of air, his head thrashi from side to side. Then suddenly the fluid is over his mo his nose, his forehead. His whole body is submerged! The level of fluid continues to rise towards the unseen t of the cylinder.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Squeezes his eyes shut, holding his breath. Not so much  fighting this anymore as simply floating in place, waitin for his inevitable death...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PLAINS OF CYDONIA. NIGHT
dialogues.text: WIDEVIEW FROM ABOVE, as the energy vortex bends from side side, pushing back the swirling storm that surrounds the  Face. As the vortex coalesces its energy into a cylindric shape, we see through its center to a rising form -- the  Martian ship. It is a flattened convex circle whose matte metallic angles replicate the "Face" imagery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Face burns away around us, the Martian ship begins rise and spin.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PLAINS OF CYDONIA. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The vortex is now a tight, rapidly spinning cylinder. As draws more and more power from the disintegrating Face, t Martian ship in its center spins faster and faster.

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL'S FACE
dialogues.text: Is spinning and shaking too, more and more violently, as huge buildup of G-forces tears at his body. We're reminde of Nick Willis just before the vortex exploded him; is th same thing about to happen to McConnell? His eyes remain tightly shut, bubbles are streaming from lips. His last breath is nearly exhausted, it's being sha from his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARTIAN SPACESHIP. NIGHT
dialogues.text: As we MOVE IN CLOSER ON HIS FACE, we suddenly see, with h a SERIES of rapid-fire, almost subliminal IMAGES FROM THE PAST. We recognize each one. Previously, though, we saw t as still photos; now they have movement, life, and we vie them from new and slightly different angles. These images INTERCUT with glimpses of McConnell's pale, shaking, near death face in the present...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: THE YOUNG MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Under the Christmas tree, lifts his new model rocket from its box. He turns to us, smiling joyfully. A blinding whi flash, and he disappears...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: THE TEENAGED MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Is on her porch, under a night sky, bending down to the  eyepiece of a TELESCOPE. She looks up at us with a shy, p smile. A blinding white flash and she's gone...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE AND MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: In flight suits, holding their helmets, stand on the wing a fighter jet. The radiant young couple turn to each othe kissing. A blinding white flash and they vanish...

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: In an astronaut's pressure suit, drifts rapidly towards u reeling in along a tether. A man's gloved hand is  outstretched, reaching for her. As she grips the hand, we see her triumphant expression through her faceplate. A  blinding flash; she's gone...

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL'S FACE
dialogues.text: Is shaking savagely; he is very near death. And then, all once, the SHAKING STOPS. Time itself seems to stop. McConnell opens his eyes, staring STRAIGHT AT US. And the fully accepting his fate, he throws his head back, opens mouth and takes in a deep lungful of the fluid. He can br it. His eyes widen in surprise and understanding. He can brea it! This fluid will keep him alive! His whole body relaxe the tension draining from his head and shoulders, as he f trusts this launch for the first time. And then, with his eyes wide open, he sees, from memory, one final image...

dialogues.speaker: BRIDAL VEIL IS LIFTED
dialogues.text: And REVEALS, in CLOSEUP, the beautiful face, the shining  eyes of MAGGIE McCONNELL. Beatific, eternal. She gazes  directly INTO CAMERA, then smiles...

dialogues.speaker: MCCONNELL
dialogues.text: Smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PLAINS OF CYDONIA. NIGHT
dialogues.text: WIDE VIEW, FROM ABOVE, as the energy vortex changes from orange to blue-white. It ROARS with terrifying power as i top starts to bend, angling like a telescope towards a  specific point in the stars. Then the Martian ship -- a  rounded darker form, little more than a blip within the v blue-white column of energy -- shoots away from the surfa leaving only a blacked crater where the Face had been.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARS. HIGH ATMOSPHERE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: ANGLE FROM DEEP SPACE, LOOKING DOWN, as the Martian ship, riding its blue-white column of energy, streaks up into t vast blackness, like a narrowly focused spotlight piercin the night. Down below, we can see the dust storm in all i vastness still boiling orange and brown across the planet surface, which it now completely covers. As the Martian ship flashes by us, it passes another ship much smaller and slower, rising through the storm clouds a different trajectory. We recognize the familiar, comfor sight of the ERV. PUSHING IN QUICKLY ON THIS. We see three figures in the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ERV COCKPIT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Luke, Terri and Phil are strapped in, with their accelera just starting to level off, when suddenly their cockpit  interior is starkly bathed in white light. They wince at unearthly radiance, shielding their faceplates with glove hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God. Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through their cockpit window, they watch the Martian ship hurtle by them at a hundred times their speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke nods. Their eyes are glistening. Luke's voice is a  whisper, both of prayer and farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godspeed Jim McConnell.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking through the cockpit window we see the Martian shi receding into the infinite distance of space -- a long bl white scratch that in moments begins to fade. Finally it a tiny point of light, taking its place amongst the limit expanse of the star-filled heavens.
